alert.note: Alert for South Washington Cascade Foothills (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 24 at 6:12AM PST until December 26 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...AN INCREASINGLY COLD AND SNOWY HOLIDAY WEEKEND IN STORE... .A colder airmass will slide down into the region and push snow levels to sea level Christmas night. Expect widespread snow showers across northwestern Oregon and southwestern Washington through early Monday morning. Chances for snow decrease after Monday, but it will be much colder as arctic air spills into the region. ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 2 feet above 1000 feet and 6 to 12 inches below 1000 feet. * WHERE...South Washington Cascade Foothills. * WHEN...Until 4 PM PST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow level around 1500 ft will lower below 1000 ft tonight into Saturday.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest road conditions visit https://www.tripcheck.com or https://wsdot.com/travel/real-time/map or by calling 5 1 1
